member.summary: If a sequence received doesnt match with the number we expect ,that means we lost a sequence and got to send the request to recover the message to the TCP client portal connection by setting first and last seq

member.name: T:Blackwood.Framework.UDPSocketConnection.StateObject

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.Log.PrintToOutput
member.summary: Whether or not to print to std out (Debug.Writeline)

member.name: T:Blackwood.Framework.OrderRouter
member.summary:
OrderRouter keeps track of orders placed. It allows Cancels, Rejects, and Fills to be sent to the correct BWOrder object (to then be fired off to the user as events).
Initially, orders are kept track of by a clientOrderID assigned here. After an order is sent to the client portal and messages are received, it comes back with a SmartID. The order is found by looking at clientOrderID, then matched to SmartID, and from the on is kept track of by that SmartID.

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.OrderRouter.m_numOrders
member.summary: used as an initial value to set CBWMsgOrder.ClientID for internal order tracking

member.name: T:Blackwood.Framework.MulticastClientPortalConnection
member.summary: Provides a single ip:port connection to a client portal. Create an instance by passing an IP Address and port to open a socket connection to on the client portal server. Connect by calling ConnectToClientPortal(). Pass a CBWMsgLogin to make a connection specific to one UserID. Then send messages by calling SendMessage().

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.MulticastClientPortalConnection.OnCBWMessage(Blackwood.CBWMessages.CS_MESSAGE,System.UInt32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: The responsibility of the base class's implementation of OnCBWMessage is to create a CBWMessage of the proper type based on the message's nType and broadcast that in the ClientPortalMessage event. The only message that is processed here in the base class is CS_LOGIN. Other handling of messages (like insertion into the StockCache) is handled in the overridden methods of classes that derive from ClientPortalConnectionBase (MarketDataClientPortalConnection and OrderClientPortalConnection).

member.name: T:Blackwood.Framework.HistoricClientPortalConnection
member.summary: An extension of ClientPortalConnectionBase functionality which handles a historic data connection.

member.name: T:Blackwood.Framework.ClientPortalConnectionBase
member.summary: Provides a single ip:port connection to a client portal. Create an instance by passing an IP Address and port to open a socket connection to on the client portal server. Connect by calling ConnectToClientPortal(). Pass a CBWMsgLogin to make a connection specific to one UserID. Then send messages by calling SendMessage().

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.ClientPortalConnectionBase.OnCBWMessage(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The responsibility of the base class's implementation of OnCBWMessage is to create a CBWMessage of the proper type based on the message's nType and broadcast that in the ClientPortalMessage event. The only message that is processed here in the base class is CS_LOGIN. Other handling of messages (like insertion into the StockCache) is handled in the overridden methods of classes that derive from ClientPortalConnectionBase (MarketDataClientPortalConnection and OrderClientPortalConnection).

member.name: T:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrder
member.summary: Represents an order in the Blackwood system.

member.name: T:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for BWOrders. Provides functionality for setting parameters of an order, updating the order on order event messages.

member.summary: The number of shares the user wants. This cannot be changed after the order has been placed.

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.m_cumulativeSizeExecuted
member.summary: The cumulative total of the shares that have been executed so far.

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.m_lastExecPrice
member.summary: The share price of the last execution (not average price).

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.m_lastExecSize
member.summary: The size of the last execution (not cumulative).

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.m_lastExecVenue
member.summary: The venue on which the last execution took place.

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.m_avgPrice
member.summary: The average price for all executions so far.

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.m_isStarted
member.summary: Whether this order has been sent to the server.

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.m_isAlive
member.summary: Whether this order can still change status / receive messages from client portal.

member.name: F:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.m_symbol
member.summary: The symbol this order is set. This cannot be changed after the order is placed.

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.#ctor(Blackwood.Framework.BWSession,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor for the abstract base class for BWOrders
member.param: Order Symbol
Order Size

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.UpdateOnExecution(System.Double,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: NOTE: tracking the avg price, only works for a given order, if it's executions are on one side of the market. i.e. not agents that both buy and sell - will not compute the average correctly For sell and short side execution (the qty's must be reported as negatives!)

member.name: P:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrderBase.IsAlive
member.summary: Is the order active in some fashion (or server or market)

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrder.#ctor(Blackwood.Framework.BWSession,System.String,Blackwood.CBWMessages.ORDER_SIDE,System.UInt32,System.Double,Blackwood.CBWMessages.ORDER_TYPE,System.Int32,Blackwood.CBWMessages.FEED_ID,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Create a new BWOrder object suitable for sending to an order connection.
member.param: The BWSession for this order.
The symbol of the stock this order will buy or sell.
The side (buy, sell, etc.) of the order.
The quantity of shares to buy/sell.
The price in dollars for the order. Set to zero for market orders.
The type of order (limit, market, etc).
The time in which the order is valid.
The venue on which the order should execute.
A field to mark order as hidden.

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.BWOrder.#ctor(Blackwood.Framework.BWSession,System.String,Blackwood.CBWMessages.ORDER_SIDE,System.UInt32,System.Double,System.Double,Blackwood.CBWMessages.ORDER_TYPE,System.Int32,Blackwood.CBWMessages.FEED_ID,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Create a new BWOrder object suitable for sending to an order connection.
member.param: The BWSession for this order.
The symbol of the stock this order will buy or sell.
The side (buy, sell, etc.) of the order.
The quantity of shares to buy/sell.
The price in dollars for the order. Set to zero for market orders.
The price in dollars for the stop order.
The type of order (limit, market, etc).
The time in which the order is valid.
The venue on which the order should execute.
A field to mark order as hidden.

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.BWSession.ConnectToOrderRouting(System.String,System.String,System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Opens a connection to an orders client portal and sends a login message.
member.param: Login to use on the client portal.
Password for connecting to the client portal.
IP address of the client portal.
Port of the client portal.
Whether to record log messages.
Whether to send previous execution messages.
Whether to send admin access data messages.
Whether to send previous cancel/order/position messages.

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.BWSession.ConnectToMarketData(System.String,System.String,System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Opens a connection to a market data client portal and sends a login message. Throws ArgumentNullException if a required argument is null. Throws ClientPortalConnectionException if the login was not successful.
member.param: Login to use on the client portal.
Password for connecting to the client portal.
IP address of the client portal.
Port of the client portal.
Whether to update the books in the internal stock cache.

member.name: M:Blackwood.Framework.BWSession.ConnectToHistoricData(System.String,System.String,System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens a connection to a historic data client portal and sends a login message. Throws ArgumentNullException if a required argument is null. Throws ClientPortalConnectionException if the login was not successful.
member.param: Login to use on the client portal.
Password for connecting to the client portal.
IP address of the client portal.
Port of the client portal.

member.summary: Opens connections to both Market Data and Orders client portals.

Password for connecting to the client portals.
IP address of the market data client portal.
Port of the market data client portal.
IP address of the orders client portal.
Port of the orders client portal.

Whether to send previous execution messages.
Whether to send admin access data messages.
Whether to send previous cancel messages.
